rules.natural: If a user is authorized for a device, then the device has emergency access.
Whenever a user is authorized for a device, the device is registered.
Either a user is authorized for a device or a global exception applies to the device.
Provided that an admin performs an admin override, then if the device has emergency access, it is compliant.
Under the condition that a device has a policy exception, if it has emergency access, then it is compliant.
Either there is a maintenance window at a time or a security incident occurs at that time.
Provided that a security incident occurs at a time, the device has a policy exception.
Whenever a user has temporary authorization, the device is authenticated.
Either a security audit is conducted at a time or a compliance check is performed at that time.
If a compliance check is performed at a time, then provided that a user is authorized for the device, the user has temporary authorization.
Whenever an access review is conducted at a time, an access log is maintained for the device.
Provided that an audit is scheduled at a time, if a security audit is conducted at that time, then an access review is conducted.
Either an admin performs a manual override or an audit is scheduled at a time.
If a device is new, then it is unregistered.
Provided that a quarantine policy applies to a device, if the device is unregistered, then it is not blocked.
Either a quarantine policy applies to a device or a security alert is triggered for the device.
Whenever threat detection is performed by a system, if a security alert is triggered for a device, then provided that the device is unregistered, it is not blocked.
Either threat detection is performed by a system or an automated response is executed by a system.
Whenever an automated response is executed by a system, a security system is in place.
If a device is authenticated, then it is connected to the network.
Under the condition that an isolation protocol is activated for a device, if a security alert is triggered for the device, then provided that the device is unregistered, it is not blocked.
If a security system is in place, then protection is active for the system.
Whenever protection is active for a system, an isolation protocol is activated for the device.
If a device is compliant, then it is authenticated.
Provided that a device is registered, it is compliant.
Either a device is blocked or a global exception applies to the device.
If a device is suspicious, then it is not blocked.
Under the condition that an investigation is conducted on a device, if the device is not suspicious, then it is monitored.
If it is not the case that a maintenance window implies an admin override, then normal operation takes place at that time.
If it is not the case that the negation of a maintenance window implying an admin override leads to no normal operation, then extended maintenance occurs at that time.
Provided that a device is not suspicious, it is not monitored.

facts.natural: An investigation is conducted on a device.
Extended maintenance does not occur at a time.
An access log is not maintained for a device.
A device is not connected to a network.
An admin does not perform a manual override.

target.natural: A global exception applies to a device.

If a device is unregistered, then it is not blocked.
Under the condition that a device is new, it is not blocked.
A device is not blocked.
A global exception applies to a device.

(A1 → A10).natural: If a user is authorized for a device, then the device has emergency access.

(A1 → A17).natural: Provided that a user is authorized for a device, the user has temporary authorization.

(A1 → A2).natural: Whenever a user is authorized for a device, the device is connected to the network.

(A1 → A3).natural: Under the condition that a user is authorized for a device, the device is authenticated.

(A1 → A4).natural: If a user is authorized for a device, then the device is compliant.

(A1 → A5).natural: Whenever a user is authorized for a device, the device is registered.

(A1 ∨ G).natural: Either a user is authorized for a device or a global exception applies to the device.

(A10 → A4).natural: If a device has emergency access, then it is compliant.

(A11 → (A10 → A4)).natural: Provided that an admin performs an admin override, then if the device has emergency access, it is compliant.

(A11 ∨ A12).natural: Either an admin performs an admin override or the device has a policy exception.

(A12 → (A10 → A4)).natural: Under the condition that a device has a policy exception, if it has emergency access, then it is compliant.

(A13 → A11).natural: If a time window is a maintenance window, then an admin performs an admin override.

(A13 ∨ A14).natural: Either there is a maintenance window at a time or a security incident occurs at that time.

(A14 → A12).natural: Provided that a security incident occurs at a time, the device has a policy exception.

(A17 → A3).natural: Whenever a user has temporary authorization, the device is authenticated.

(A18 ∨ (A1 → A17)).natural: Either an access log is maintained for a device or, if a user is authorized for the device, the user has temporary authorization.

(A19 → A18).natural: If a security audit is conducted at a time, then an access log is maintained for the device.

(A19 → A21).natural: Under the condition that a security audit is conducted at a time, an access review is conducted at that time.

(A19 ∨ A20).natural: Either a security audit is conducted at a time or a compliance check is performed at that time.

(A20 → (A1 → A17)).natural: If a compliance check is performed at a time, then provided that a user is authorized for the device, the user has temporary authorization.

(A21 → A18).natural: Whenever an access review is conducted at a time, an access log is maintained for the device.

(A22 → (A19 → A21)).natural: Provided that an audit is scheduled at a time, if a security audit is conducted at that time, then an access review is conducted.

(A23 ∨ A22).natural: Either an admin performs a manual override or an audit is scheduled at a time.

(A24 → A25).natural: If a device is new, then it is unregistered.

(A24 → ¬A6).natural: Under the condition that a device is new, it is not blocked.

(A25 → ¬A6).natural: If a device is unregistered, then it is not blocked.

(A26 → (A25 → ¬A6)).natural: Provided that a quarantine policy applies to a device, if the device is unregistered, then it is not blocked.

(A26 ∨ A27).natural: Either a quarantine policy applies to a device or a security alert is triggered for the device.

(A27 → (A25 → ¬A6)).natural: If a security alert is triggered for a device, then under the condition that the device is unregistered, it is not blocked.

(A28 → (A27 → (A25 → ¬A6))).natural: Whenever threat detection is performed by a system, if a security alert is triggered for a device, then provided that the device is unregistered, it is not blocked.

(A28 ∨ A29).natural: Either threat detection is performed by a system or an automated response is executed by a system.

(A29 → (A27 → (A25 → ¬A6))).natural: If an automated response is executed by a system, then under the condition that a security alert is triggered for a device, if the device is unregistered, it is not blocked.

(A29 → A30).natural: Provided that an automated response is executed by a system, an isolation protocol is activated for the device.

(A29 → A31).natural: Whenever an automated response is executed by a system, a security system is in place.

(A3 → A2).natural: If a device is authenticated, then it is connected to the network.

(A30 → (A27 → (A25 → ¬A6))).natural: Under the condition that an isolation protocol is activated for a device, if a security alert is triggered for the device, then provided that the device is unregistered, it is not blocked.

(A31 → A30).natural: Provided that a security system is in place, an isolation protocol is activated for the device.

(A31 → A32).natural: If a security system is in place, then protection is active for the system.

(A32 → A30).natural: Whenever protection is active for a system, an isolation protocol is activated for the device.

(A4 → A3).natural: If a device is compliant, then it is authenticated.

(A5 → A4).natural: Provided that a device is registered, it is compliant.

(A6 ∨ G).natural: Either a device is blocked or a global exception applies to the device.

(A7 → ¬A6).natural: If a device is suspicious, then it is not blocked.

(A9 → (¬A7 → A8)).natural: Under the condition that an investigation is conducted on a device, if the device is not suspicious, then it is monitored.

(¬(A13 → A11) → A15).natural: If it is not the case that a maintenance window implies an admin override, then normal operation takes place at that time.

(¬(A13 → A11) → ¬A15).natural: Provided that it is not the case that a maintenance window implies an admin override, normal operation does not take place at that time.

(¬(¬(A13 → A11) → ¬A15) → A16).natural: If it is not the case that the negation of a maintenance window implying an admin override leads to no normal operation, then extended maintenance occurs at that time.

(¬A7 → A8).natural: If a device is not suspicious, then it is monitored.

(¬A7 → ¬A8).natural: Provided that a device is not suspicious, it is not monitored.

A22.natural: An audit is scheduled at a time.

A9.natural: An investigation is conducted on a device.

G.natural: A global exception applies to a device.

¬A1.natural: It is not the case that a user is authorized for a device.

¬A16.natural: Extended maintenance does not occur at a time.

¬A18.natural: An access log is not maintained for a device.

¬A2.natural: A device is not connected to a network.

¬A23.natural: An admin does not perform a manual override.
